Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Book of the Dead of Mouty
Description: This papyrus was acquired in the art trade of Paris  in 1934 by J. Capart. It is a fragment of the Book of the Dead of Mouty, containing the text of Chapters 125, 100, 102, 136A, 136B and the vignettes of Chapters 125-126 and 100. The paleography of the hieratic signs allow the dating of the papyrus to the beginning of the 18th Dynasty.
